Package edu.gcu.storefront

Class StoreFront

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gcu.storefront.StoreFront
  • public class StoreFront
extends java.lang.Object
    Facade for handling store sessions, including shopping cart operations, inventory reservations, cancellations, and checkout.

    Each shopper session is uniquely tracked using a UUID. The InventoryManager is used to manage product availability and stock control, while ShoppingCart handles item tracking per session.

    This class encapsulates the business logic of the storefront.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Batossa

    • Method Detail

      • startSession

        public java.util.UUID startSession()
        Creates a new shopper session and returns a unique session ID.
        Returns:
        a newly generated UUID representing the shopper session

      • addToCart

        public boolean addToCart​(java.util.UUID sessionId,
                         java.lang.String productId,
                         int qty)
        Adds an item to the cart and reserves inventory atomically.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the UUID of the active shopping session
        productId - the ID of the product to add
        qty - the quantity to add and reserve
        Returns:
        true if the item was successfully added; false if not enough stock
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the session ID is invalid

      • cancelSession

        public void cancelSession​(java.util.UUID sessionId)
        Cancels an active session, releasing any reserved inventory and removing the cart.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the UUID of the session to cancel

      • checkout

        public java.math.BigDecimal checkout​(java.util.UUID sessionId)
        Finalizes the purchase, deducts stock permanently, removes the cart, and returns the total cost of the transaction.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the UUID of the completed session
        Returns:
        the total amount due as a BigDecimal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the session ID is invalid
